verse.roman:
dṛṣṭvādbhutāni bahuśo
nanda-gopo bṛhadvane
vasudeva-vaco bhūyo
mānayām āsa vismitaḥ

synonyms: dṛṣṭvā—after seeing; adbhutāni—the very wonderful and astonishing incidents; bahuśaḥ—many times; nanda-gopaḥ—Nanda Mahārāja, the head of the cowherd men; bṛhadvane—in Bṛhadvana; vasudeva-vacaḥ—the words spoken by Vasudeva when Nanda Mahārāja was in Mathurā; bhūyaḥ—again and again; mānayām āsa—accepted how true they were; vismitaḥ—in great astonishment.
translation: Having seen all these incidents in Bṛhadvana, Nanda Mahārāja became more and more astonished, and he remembered the words spoken to him by Vasudeva in Mathurā.
